result.execSummary:
The defendant Shewonnia L Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Sentence Credit of 62 Days were granted if revoked.
Concurrent with: 15CM1385 & 15CM1639

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.
*FIRST 60 Days of probation to be with SCRAM monitoring.
**11/12/2015 COURT GRANTS REQUEST FROM DOC FOR DEFENDANT TO BE MONITORED BY THE SOBERLINK DEVICE INSTEAD OF SCRAM.**

Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha and Anger Management counseling and follow through as recommeded by agent.

No Violent Contact with the victim. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions, commencing forthwith.  LAST 30 Days are Stayed for use at agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith. May be transferred to Milwaukee County. NO Electronic Monitoring. Sentence credit of 122 days were granted.
Consecutive to: Case 15CM1369
Previously imposed costs were converted to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shewonnia L Scott

records.addlTxt: Order revoking huber privileges.   Signed by Judge Carter on 11/10/16.
Dated 11/08/16, from Jail Adminstration requestion that the Court formally revoke defendant's Huber privileges.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC

Defendant Shewonnia L Scott in court, in custody, with Attorney Kelsey Morin.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing on revocation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Victim Gregory M., in custody, is present and makes statements.  Attorney Morin makes statements regarding sentencing.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:  


COUNT #1:  HUBER:  180 Days (122 days credit), huber with standard release conditions to commence forthwith (Defendant already in custody) - May be transferred to Milwaukee County (No electronic monitoring)
                                    This is consecutive to Case #15CM1369(07/05/16-JC, Correct Case Number is 15CM1639).
   

                                  **Any monies owed are converted to civil judgment**
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Filed.
(Orig.) ... for amendment to the Judgment of Conviction, dated 10/29/15, filed by Agent Jumbeck.

Defendant Shewonnia L Scott in court, in custody, with Attorney Kelsey Morin.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing. State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Morin makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS (62 Days credit, if revoked)   *CONCURRENT WITH CASE #15CM1639 AND CASE #15CM1385

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia  
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No violent contact with: victim
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha and Anger Management and follow through as recommended by agent 
____1st 60 Days of probation to be with SCRAM monitoring 

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  90 DAYS, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith Defendant already in custody) - LAST 30 DAYS STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
Sentencing hearing on September 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  Court modifies bail conditions.  Sentencing date set.
